12.28.21  5:18 pm   When its someones birthday, you say "happy birthday," however, if its after their birthday you say "happy belated birthday, or, "happy early birthday." My question is where is the cutoff from belated birthday to early birthday?

     i don't say any of those things. i associate it with sadness, because the logical extrapolation is that there may be at least 364 other days of the year which are not happy

12.28.21  5:06 pm   I'm confused about how the different "burroughs" work in NYC... Like, what is a burrough?

     i think it's a 'borough' and i'm not sure exactly what it is

     Is it different from a neighborhood? In Chicago (where I lived for a while) there's different neighborhoods (wrigleyville, uptown, south loop, etc) how are these neighborhoods different from burroughs?

     the boroughs are way bigger. they have many neighborhoods in them. some of them have multiple towns in them

     Also, how do addresses work? If I lived in Brooklyn, would my street address be:

123 Main Street
Brooklyn, New York

Or

123 Main Street
Brooklyn, New York City, New York

Or

123 Main Street
New York City, New York 

      for that one, it's Brooklyn, New York.
Brooklyn is actually a town. It's also the exact same territory as the county of "Kings". "Queens" county (also a borough), is different in the sense that queens is not a town. it has towns in it, such as Astoria, Maspeth, Elmhurst, etc...
New York, New York i think specifically refers to manhattan. There is also another way that somehow "New York City" refers to all 5 counties, but i don't think that has anything to do with an address. it's weird, but so is..... everything

12.28.21  3:59 pm   in when I get older, you say when you're older you'll be more truthful. around 3 years later, meaning you're 3 years older, you say "today I woke up telling the truth" in more than a dream. therefore, you're older and more truthful. was this intentional? 

      it was intentional to make each of the songs like that. but not for any reason related to each other. i have a habit of singing about the truth, because it...... seems so real.
But if you look at the 'when i get older song', you can trace the reasoning differently. the reason 'truthful' is there, is it's clearly an answer to the previous lines about being a liar. And the reason the word 'liar' is there is, clearly, it's what follows naturally after the line "when i get younger". Because obviously no one's gonna get younger. so obviously if you say you've gotten younger then you're presumably a liar. And the way the "when i get younger" line comes about, is, just a simple songwriting tactic of taking the already established first line ("when i get older") and choosing the natural alternative options. older --> younger. So you can see, the whole existence of the word 'truthful' in that verse is clearly the result of a very logical chain of songwriting best-practices
